bioghist.p: Blanche Pierce, a noted society figure, was the daughter of Edward Y. and Emily Hill Pierce. She married Harold A. Strebeigh in 1899. The couple had two daughters, Blanche and Barbara. Mr. and Mrs. Strebeigh were divorced in 1914. Shortly after her divorce was final, Blanche Strebeigh married her second husband, Jérôme Napoléon Bonaparte, great grand-nephew of Napoleon, and son of Jérôme Napoléon Bonaparte and Caroline Le Roy Appleton. The couple resided in Washington D.C., Newport, Rhode Island, and Palm Beach, Florida. Blanche Bonaparte died in 1950 in New York.

scopecontent.p: This is a scrapbook of newspaper clippings about the life of Blanche Strebeigh Bonaparte. The clippings in the scrapbook document her first and second weddings and her activities as a member of Newport, Boston, Naragansett, and Palm Beach society.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
